memberdef.name: __XSFatalError
memberdef.initializer: fprintf( stderr, "Fatal error: %s:%i\n", strrchr( FILE, '/' ) + 1, LINE ); \ fprintf( stderr, __VA_ARGS__ ); \ fprintf( stderr, "\n" ); \ pthread_exit( NULL ); \ exit( EXIT_FAILURE );

briefdescription.para: Issues a fatal error message and aborts the program.

detaileddescription.para:
Never call this macro directly. Use XSFatalError instead.
FILE
The file name in which the error occured
LINE
The line number in which the error occured
...
Message and format arguments

briefdescription.para: Standardization of the const compiler attribute.

detaileddescription.para: Not all compiler support this attribute, so it may be defined to nothing.
